article:
'Diabetic dermadromes' constitute a group of cutaneous conditions commonly seen
in diabetic patients with longstanding disease.
Conditions included in this group are:

:* Acral dry gangrene
:* Carotenosis
:* Diabetic dermopathy
:* Diabetic bulla
:* Diabetic cheiroarthropathy
:* Mal perforans
:* Necrobiosis lipoidica
:* '[[Limited joint mobility]]' is observed in roughly 30% of diabetic patients
:  with longstanding disease.
:* '[[Waxy skin]]' is observed in roughly 50%.
categories: Skin conditions resulting from errors in metabolism
